content: Yes, Animal Farm is a stark reminder of how easily absolute power can corrupt individuals and institutions. The novel highlights the importance of having checks and balances, and the need for accountability and transparency. The lesson from the novel is that vigilance is required to prevent the abuse of power, and that people must actively seek to hold those in positions of authority accountable for their actions. Without such vigilance, it is all too easy for individuals to become corrupt, and institutions can become authoritarian, and democracy, the rule of law and human rights can be put at risk.
